title: How does music differ from the other arts? - Quora

response.answer_text: I feel that a significant difference between ‘music’ and other arts(and indeed other hobbies such as sports etc),from the point of view of a practitioner,is that music can be equally valid whether you do it with a group of people OR by yourself,in public OR in private. It seems more versatile in that sense than say,painting(which is something one generally does on their own),or theatre(always in a group,in a public setting). I could be overlooking something obvious,but that's what I came up with off the top of my head

Music is an art that uses sound in the form of musical notes,scales harmony . rhythm and other components to create new music creations That is creations that are musical in nature. It is the only art form that uses notes . Plays utilizes sound too in the form of words. That is plays that are dramas and comedies Conversely musical comedies is a marriage of words ie lyrics and music. So in conclusion music makes use of musical notes, scales, harmonies rhythm.
